title: Grow macroalgae
text: exampleRPackage shows R packages can used store communicate scientific research products metadata. Browse source code, read document tutorial creating R packages.

title: Grow macroalgae
text: Research projects produce experiments, data, analyses, manuscripts, posters, slides, stimuli materials, computational models, . However, potential added value products fully realized due limited sharing curating practices. Although transparent communication research products recently encouraged (Houtkoop et al. 2018; Lindsay 2017; Vanpaemel et al. 2015; Wicherts et al. 2006; Klein et al. 2018; Martone, Garcia-Castro, VandenBos 2018; Rouder, Haaf, Snyder 2019; Rouder 2016), efforts often focus narrowly sharing data (sometimes analysis code). , practical value sharing often limited poor documentation, incompatible file formats, lack organization, resulting low rates reproducibility (Hardwicke et al. 2018). Standardization protocols sharing beneficial; , standards yet emerged. Instead developing another standard, suggest borrowing existing standards practices software engineering. Specifically, R package standard, additional R authoring tools, provides robust framework organizing sharing reproducible research products. advances data-sharing standards emerged: much psychological science now customary share data Open Science Framework (OSF). However, materials often contain idiosyncratic file organization minimal missing documentation raw data. specific areas, organization documentation standards emerged, (e.g., BIDS framework neuroscience, Gorgolewski et al. 2016), usually consider data code instead project whole. comprehensive proposals described Transparency Openness Promotion (Nosek et al. 2015), Peer Reviewers’ Openness initiative guidelines (Morey et al. 2016), fall short describing detailed standards organization metadata. sought standard organizing sharing adhere FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) guidelines maximize reuse potential data support “discovery good data management” (Wilkinson et al. 2016). Additionally, recognized added value including research outputs (“products”; e.g., manuscripts) beyond datasets reproducible collection materials openly available internet transparency ease access. identified R package standard modern online-based workflows solution doesn’t present overwhelming overhead already busy researchers. , present tutorial creating R packages sharing research products, data, functions, analysis code embedded narrative documents.

what: Create a package with R Studio
title: Grow macroalgae
text: First, use R Studio create new R Project. Click “File” -> “New Project…” -> “New Directory” -> “R Package”. brings menu give package name, specify create hard drive. enable Git (Vuorre Curley 2018), make sure “Create git repository” box checked (see ). tutorial, create R package called exampleRPackage; want follow tutorial exactly, choose name package. click “Create project”, project’s files folders look like : .gitignore .Rbuildignore hidden files, specify files ignored Git (Vuorre Curley 2018), R package building operations, respectively. can ignore now. DESCRIPTION file describing package, NAMESPACE functions. R/ folder scripts contain R functions. exampleRPackage.Rproj identifies folder R package project. man/ “manuals” folder files documenting package’s functions. package already functional, contains nothing useful: Next, introduce edit content create complete package contains data functions.
code: . ├── .gitignore ├── .Rbuildignore ├── DESCRIPTION ├── NAMESPACE ├── R │   └── hello.R ├── exampleRPackage.Rproj └── man     └── hello.Rd

title: Grow macroalgae
text: DESCRIPTION file describes package standard, machine-readable format. file automatically created example content R Studio. However, need edit file reflect details package, making sure don’t change formatting: file read R package creating process, file must therefore remain machine-readable. ’s example: file serves two important purposes. First, describes package (Title, Version number, Authors, Description). Authors@R field contains person information R syntax (see ?person), can include multiple persons wrapping c(). (Encoding Lazydata field can ignored, purposes.) Second, specifies package’s dependencies (Depends, Imports, Suggests [latter included example]). important differences three fields specifying package’s dependencies. First, rarely, ever, use Depends, except specifying version R package requires. Imports common field listing R packages package requires: Packages listed Imports installed package installed. write functions (see ) package, can use package’s functions :: operator (e.g. stringr::to_title_case()). information DESCRIPTION, describing package, see http://r-pkgs..co.nz/description.html.
code: Package: exampleRPackage Type: Package Title: An example R package Version: 0.1.0 Authors@R: person("Matti", "Vuorre", email = "mv2521@columbia.edu",                   role = c("aut", "cre")) Description: This package is an example R package. Encoding: UTF-8 LazyData: true Depends:      R (>= 3.1) Imports:     stringr

title: Grow macroalgae
text: Although part R package standard, recommend creating readme file gives additional narrative description package. recommend writing file Markdown R Markdown (Allaire et al. 2016). create R Markdown file, use following function usethis package: function created file, also printed message indicating file added “.Rbuildignore” file. Make changes README.Rmd R Studio’s text editor. done, click Knit R Studio, produces Markdown file displays nicely package hosted online (see ). (README.Rmd uses package, Knit clicking “Install Restart” R Studio’s build tab.) Now described package, let’s add data .

title: Grow macroalgae
text: purposes saving data R package resulting data easily available, described organized standard, machine-readable format. , package’s source code version control (Vuorre Curley 2018), data versioned well. Broadly, 3 steps including data R package: 1. Placing raw data “data-raw” directory, 2. creating R script processes raw data creates R data object “data” directory, 3. documenting final data object. First, add raw data data-raw/ directory. use convenience function usethis package create folder, also add folder .Rbuildignore file, ensuring R package build process ignore . , moved example data file (small simulated dataset) “data-raw” directory, created “preprocess.R” file directory. Usually, file contain code pre-processing data, example needed. example preprocessing file simply reads data file, runs following command: command takes exampleData object R environment (created script) saves R data object data/. result, R package now includes data set called exampleData. Finally, resulting R data object documented standard format placing data.R file “R” directory. document data set, create file called data.R R directory. , use roxygen2 (Wickham, Danenberg, Eugster 2017) documentation syntax write data object’s documentation R/data.R file. look similar following exampleData object: key features documentation file (top bottom code listing): line begins #' indicate roxygen2 syntax. First, data set title (@title). @description field optional highly recommended longer description data. example, collection procedures, respondents, etc. @format field describes object (e.g. R data.frame), dimensions, describes variables (e.g. group score). @source field includes source data, citation academic article, website, example. Finally, last line name data object quotation marks. can document multiple data files R/data.R file; simply leave one blank line . details creating, documenting, including data sets R packages, see http://r-pkgs..co.nz/data.html.
code: use_data_raw() use_data(exampleData) #' @title Scores of Group A and Group B #' #' @description A data set with the scores of two groups. #' #' @format A data frame with 60 rows and 2 variables: #' \describe{ #'   \item{group}{Participant's group, A or B.} #'   \item{score}{The participant's score in hypothetical task.} #' } #' @source <https://www.github.com/mvuorre/exampleRPackage> "exampleData"

title: Grow macroalgae
text: Functions R packages portable, others can install package R console, load , start using functions immediately. Packages can also depend packages (depended ), R automatically installs requirements functions work appropriately. Functions within R packages documented standardized manner, documentation function can viewed R (e.g. try ?mean) online. Learning following R conventions declaring functions pedagogical benefit researcher may improve practices. also reuse benefit: Functions can difficult find old scripts, easy find load called existing package. Thus, formally including one’s functions R packages facilitates reproducibility sharing. include functions package, place functions’ scripts files “R” directory. first created package, directory created example hello.R script. Open file R Studio’s text editor, delete text function. , R Studio menu, click “Code” -> “Insert Roxygen Skeleton”. creates template documentation function’s file, can manually fill describe function. exampleRPackage includes example function, whose source looks like : function, data set , documented roxygen2 syntax. Many fields similar section data documentation. , also @param fields, describe function’s arguments . @return field describes function return. @export indicates function exported package; , made available attach package library(). also @examples field can include executable examples use function. function’s description actual code. information writing functions R packages, see http://r-pkgs..co.nz/r.html.
code: #' Personal greeting #' #' @description Greet a person and appropriately capitalize their name. #' #' @param name Your name (character string; e.g. "john doe"). #' #' @return A character string, capitalized to title case. #' @export #' #' @examples #' hello("james bond") hello <- function(name = "your name") {     name <- stringr::str_to_title(name)     print(paste("Hello,", name)) }

title: Grow macroalgae
text: almost ready minimal example package. remaining steps finish documenting package, build install computer. package now documented DESCRIPTION file, functions data documented respective files R/ directory. data functions documented roxygen2 syntax, must subsequently translated R’s documentation files man/ directory, dependencies must listed NAMESPACE file. Fortunately, don’t need manually. First, ensure R Studio generates documentation roxygen. Go Tools -> Project Options… -> Build Tools, ensure “Generate documentation roxygen” checked, “Automatically run roxygen running install restart” checked subsequent “Configure” menu. , delete two files, man/hello.Rd NAMESPACE, R Studio created automatically started package. Finally, R Studio’s “Build” tab, click “Install Restart”. automatically writes documentation man/, appropriate dependencies package’s exported functions NAMESPACE file, subsequently never need () edit manually. , whenever edited documentation, clicking “Install Restart” update documentation files. read documenting data functions, please visit http://r-pkgs..co.nz/man.html. clicked “Install Restart” also, rather obviously, installed package restarted R. , following tutorial, created hello() function exampleData data sets, now available package attached: can view help pages prepending names question mark:
code: library(exampleRPackage) hello("my name") #> [1] "Hello, My Name" head(exampleData) #>   group     score #> 1     a  97.18260 #> 2     a  86.87440 #> 3     a 107.95184 #> 4     a 102.70070 #> 5     a  97.22694 #> 6     a  94.33976 ?hello ?exampleData

what: Creating a website for the R package
title: Grow macroalgae
text: package’s source code hosted GitHub, can showcase contents website. example, can view exampleRPackage’s website https://mvuorre.github.io/exampleRPackage/. create websites packages, need pkgdown R package (Wickham 2017). installing package, set required files website: , create website, run: website now available docs/index.html. can open view locally. However, certainly want upload website somewhere others can access well. easiest option host GitHub. , assume created package local Git repository pushed repository GitHub. Push current changes GitHub, go package’s GitHub website, click “Settings”, scroll “GitHub Pages”. , click “Source” pull-menu currently says “None”, choose “master branch /docs folder”. Save changes. little , page visible https://username.github.io/packagename. example, exampleRPackage’s website https://mvuorre.github.io/exampleRPackage. many options customizing website; see https://pkgdown.r-lib.org.

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Macroalgae height

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Nf  spec_params vector named numbers. Must include parameters: h_max, maximum species height. h_max supplied algae height == h_max h_a, h_b h_c, parameters governing height change N_f

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: scalar macroalgae height (m)

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Calculates macroalgae height : $$h_m = \left(\frac{N_f}{h_a}\right)^{h_b} + h_c$$ maximum h_{max}. Defaults \(h_a=1000\), \(h_b=1\) \(h_c=0\). Algae height therefore defaults \(N_f \times 10^{-3}\) parameters supplied.

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
text: Total drag coefficient

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
code: C_t(   u_c,   u_b,   macro_state = c(biomass, hm),   SA_WW = 0.5 * (0.0306/2),   site_params,   constants = c(s = 0.0045, gam = 1.13, a2 = 0.2^2, Cb = 0.0025) )

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
text: macro_state vector named numbers. Must include: biomass, macroalgae wet weight (g) hm, algae height (m) SA_WW conversion wet weight surface area (default 0.5\(\times\)0.5\(\times\)0.0306, based Macrocystis pyrifera) site_params vector named numbers. Must include: hz, total water depth (m) hc, vertical water column occupied canopy (m) d_top, depth top canopy beneath water surface (m) constants vector named numbers defining extra constants attenuation submodel. Must include: s = 0.0045 gam = 1.13 a2 = 0.2^2 Cb = 0.0025

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
text: total drag coefficient C_t

text: conc substrate concentration uptake_shape kinetic shape substrate uptake. One "linear" "Michaelis-Menton" ("MM"). Defaults Michaelis-Menton. Nform_abbr abbreviation used spec_params relevant nitrogen form. See details. spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: M C linear uptake, V K Michaelis-Menton uptake uptake_shape "linear" "MM" ("Michaelis-Menton"). required one set parameters provided.

title: Get the correct uptake rate — get_uptake
text: Gives substrate uptake rate based shape species-specific parameters supplied. shape supplied, attempts infer correct shape supplied parameters. Nform_abbr allows function link species parameters concentration. E.g. Nform_abbr = "amm" (ammonium) function look M_amm C_amm V_amm K_amm spec_params ignore uptake parameters may included substrates.

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: start date, start growth period, date -sea deployment grow_days integer, number temperature vector light vector velocity vector nitrate vector ammonium vector other_N vector site_params named vector species-specific parameters - see details spec_params named vector site-specific parameters - see details initials named vector macroalgae starting conditions other_constants named vector miscellaneous constants, including: s = 0.0045, experimentally-derived shape factor macroalgae movement water gam = 1.13, modified drag coefficient macroalgae a2 = 0.2^2, Cb = 0.0025, bottom friction coefficient

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: dataframe outputs

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: Example csv spec_params & site_params required? Note final growth dataframe inclusive start end date, environmental vectors must

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: Calculates relative limitation growth rate due light availability, via: $$I_{lim} = \frac{e}{K \cdot d_{top}} \times \Biggl[e^{-\frac{I_z e^{-K \cdot d_{top}}}{I_o}} - e^{-\frac{I_z}{I_o}} \Biggr]$$ \(I_{z}=e^{-k_W \cdot d_{top}}\) irradiance cultivation depth \(K=k_{m}+kW\) total attenuation coefficient. \(k_{m}\) additional attenuation coefficient macroalgae biomass, calculated : $$k_{m} = a_{cs} \times N_f \times \text{max} \Biggl( \frac{h_{m}}{d_{top}}, 1 \Biggr) \times \frac{1}{\text{min}(h_{m}, d_{top})}$$ \(h_m\) macroalgae height.

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) surface irradiance, PAR (\(\mu\)mol photons m\(^{-2}\) s\(^{-1}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: a_cs, carbon-specific self-shading constant I_o, light saturation parameter h_a, h_b h_c, parameters governing height change N_f h_max, maximum species height site_params vector named numbers. Must include: \(d_{top}\) -surface  depth (m) top macroalgae culture \(kW\) light-attenuation coefficient open water

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: scalar relative light limitation growth (0 1)

what: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
title: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
text: Calculates light attenuation coefficient water via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] K_d(PAR) &=& 1.584 × SDD^{-0.894} \end{array}$$ SDD Secchi disk depth. Equation adapted Zhang, Y., Liu, X., Yin, Y., Wang, M., & Qin, B. (2012). Predicting light attenuation coefficient Secchi disk depth beam attenuation coefficient large, shallow, freshwater lake. Hydrobiologia, 693(1), 29–37. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10750-012-1084-2.

title: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: macroalgae fragmentation rate ($D$) calculated : $$D = D_{ve} \times U_0 + D_{tu} + D_{m}$$ \(D_{ve}\) linear coefficient loss laminar velocity (U_0), \(D_{tu}\) loss rate specified level turbulence (static, low, medium, high), \(D_{m}\) base loss rate.

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: turbulence optional level turbulence. Options "none"/"static", "low", "medium"/"mid", "high". spec_params vector named numbers. default 0 supplied. Can include: D_m, constant (base) loss rate D_ve, linear coefficient loss laminar velocity D_st, loss rate static water (turbulence = 0, "none" "static") D_lo, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 1 "low") D_mi, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 2 "medium") D_hi, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 3 "high")

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: scalar macroalgae loss (% d-1)

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: Note parameter U0 default. one supplied, loss due velocity default 0 regardless value D_ve supplied.

text: conc vector range N concentrations tested (defaults seq(0, 50, 0.25)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include parameters appropriate form : \(V_{max}\), maximum uptake rate \(K_{c}\), half-saturation constant /M, slope N uptake increasing substrate concentration C, intercept form form nitrogen taken , correspond given parameters. One "ammonium" (default), "nitrate", "". shape one "Michaelis-Menton" ("MM", default), "linear", "".

Must include: T_opt optimum temperature macroalgae growth T_min minimum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c < T_min, growth = 0) T_max maximum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c > T_max, growth = 0)

Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: Calculates internal nutrient quotient \(Q\) via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] Q &=& Q_{min} \left(1 + \frac{N_s}{N_f}\right) \end{array}$$

title: Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) Ns Stored nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: Q_min, minimum internal nutrient quotient

title: Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: Calculates internal nutrient quotient \(Q_{int}\) relative effect growth rate \(Q_{lim}\) via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] Q_{int} &=& Q_{min} \left(1 + \frac{N_s}{N_f}\right) \\ Q_{lim} &=& \frac{Q_{int} - Q_{min}}{Q_{int} - K_c} \end{array}$$

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) Ns Stored nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: Q_min, minimum nutrient quotient Q_max, maximum nutrient quotient K_c, half-saturation growth constant

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: scalar relative limitation internal nutrient reserves growth (0 1)

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: following function documentation copied verbatim file modules/data.atmosphere/R/metutils.R https://github.com/PecanProject/pecan/. easy straight way convert MJ/m2 mu mol photons / m2 / s (PAR). Note: 1 Watt = 1J/s conversion based following reasoning 0.12 much total radiation expected ocurr hour maximum insolation (guesstimate) 2.07 coefficient converts MJ mol photons (approximate taken ... Campbell Norman (1998). Introduction Environmental Biophysics. pg 151 'energy content solar radiation PAR waveband 2.35 x 10^5 J/mol' See also chapter radiation basics (10) input total solar radiation obtain PAR spectrum need multiply 0.486 last value 0.486 based approximation PAR 0.45-0.50 total radiation means 1e6 / (2.35e6) * 0.486 = 2.07 1e6 converts mol mu mol 1/3600 divides values hours seconds

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: Fernando Miguez David LeBauer

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: Given species parameters, returns relative limitation growth rate according CTMI curve: $$\begin{array}[ccc]      T_{lim} &=& \frac{(T_c-T_{max})(T_c-T_{min})^2}{(T_{opt}-T_{min})[(T_{opt}-T_{min})(T_c-T_{opt})-(T_{opt}-T_{max})(T_{opt}+T_{min}-2T_c)]} \end{array}$$

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: Tc temperature evaluate spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: T_opt optimum temperature macroalgae growth T_min minimum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c < T_min, growth = 0) T_max maximum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c > T_max, growth = 0)

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: scalar relative temperature limitation growth (0 1)

Must include: hz, total water depth (m) hc, vertical water column occupied canopy (m) d_top, depth top canopy beneath water surface (m) constants vector named numbers defining extra constants attenuation submodel. Must include: s = 0.0045 gam = 1.13 a2 = 0.2^2 Cb = 0.0025
